DOC.brief_summary: In this retrospective study, the investigators examined incidence and risk factors of postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in patients with fentanyl-based intravenous patient-controlled analgesia (IV-PCA).
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Intravenous Patient-controlled Analgesia (IV-PCA) With Fentanyl in Adults for Acute Postoperative Pain Control
DOC.criteria: 1. Adults between 20 to 60 years old 2. Date from 1st, May 2011 to 31st, October 2011 3. Patients with fentanyl based intravenous patientcontrolled analgesia for postoperative pain control 1. Reoperation within 48 hours 2. Patients who cannot express numerical rating scale for pain due to sedation
